shortdesc.ph: Starts the audio playback device test.

section.p: This method tests if the audio playback device works properly. Once a user starts the test, the SDK plays an audio file specified by the user. If the user can hear the audio, the playback device works properly.
After calling this method, the SDK triggers the callback every 100 ms, reporting uid = 1 and the volume information of the playback device.
section.note: Ensure that you call this method before joining a channel.

pd.p:
The path of the audio file for the audio playback device test in UTF-8.
Supported file formats: wav, mp3, m4a, and aac.
Supported file sample rates: 8000, 16000, 32000, 44100, and 48000 Hz.

ul.li: 0: Success, and you can hear the sound of the specified audio file.
